response.content:
Thanks for the feedback, though it's completely useless as I have no clue what do you mean. As the course author, I know what I'm saying in it, and it is definitely explaining a lot. Whether things are clear or not is debatable - this also depends on experience level. The course is definitely for people who worked with JavaScript before. And it is also clearly stated from the beginning.

I'm sorry you don't like the course to rate it so low, on the other hand, I'm sure the course is valuable and one can learn a lot from it. Probably you were looking for something else.

response.content: There is a Q&A section for people having issues. This student did refund the course. Did not ask any questions. The course contains a straightforward guide on how to set-up (for all systems). With any software though, things might go wrong. This might be due to software fault, or student system fault, or student mistake. If the course would just teach wrong, it would not have the rating it has and I would probably hear earlier that people are having issues. So it seems the issue is just on your side, and you decided to trash the course for that - which you just said haven't even gone through.

results.content:
Having recently finished the "Master Laravel PHP in 2019" course by Piotr Jura, I thought I would step up to his latest course, the next level:
"How to build a Single Page Application with Laravel (6+) PHP Framework and Vue.js."

This new course was great as well as challenging and it has meet all my expectations!

Piotr Jura is a very capable instructor, but more importantly he is a great software developer and architect.
results.content_html:
Having recently finished the "Master Laravel PHP in 2019" course by Piotr Jura, I thought I would step up to his latest course, the next level:
"How to build a Single Page Application with Laravel (6+) PHP Framework and Vue.js."

This new course was great as well as challenging and it has meet all my expectations!

Piotr Jura is a very capable instructor, but more importantly he is a great software developer and architect.

results.content:
I ran into a problem， Google all day and I couldn't find a solution. I ended up joined the discord group for this course and asked my question, 
Thanks to piotrjura(lecturer for this course), he is quickly responded my questions, explain to me the reason and give the solution.
Another point is that the course is up-to-date, I followed this course by using the latest version Laravel 7, and it works perfectly.
I must recommend this course to anyone who interested in laravel with vueJS. This course will never let you down.

results.content:
A great course, the instructor knows his stuff. He actually codes as he goes, and therefore you even see mistakes, and how he fixes them. That annoyed me at first, but I grew to like seeing the process. 
His accent is quirky and requires a bit extra concentration to understand.
It took quite a while to get through the course, and quite a lot of determination, but I think it was well worth it

results.content:
This is a great course so far, but isn't complete. As of now it just stops with several key features missing from the application. You try to make a booking site for properties (think AirBNB). but there is no user authentication (not advertised as having user auth, but likely something you would need for this type of app), no actual checkout page (though the last chapter starts on this, but stops short) and no way to add new bookable properties without just editing the database directly.

Once complete it will be a great learning resource.
results.content_html:

You try to make a booking site for properties (think AirBNB). but there is no user authentication (not advertised as having user auth, but likely something you would need for this type of app), no actual checkout page (though the last chapter starts on this, but stops short) and no way to add new bookable properties without just editing the database directly.

Once complete it will be a great learning resource.

results.content: The course is really amazing and good for professional developers.
results.content_html: The course is really amazing and good for professional developers.

results.content:
Piotr holds a deep understanding of both Laravel and Vue.  His code typing is fluid in both; he never pauses to consider how to call vuex state or whether some PHP function needs a forward or backslash.  He's good.  There's virtually no wasted time in recognizing that you, the viewer, know more about the subject than the teacher, i.e. stumbling through errors or a non-best-practice use of a controller.

The course is well worth the money and doesn't attempt to be an all-in-one masterclass.  As part of my overall strategy to be the very best I can be in both Laravel & Vue, I highly recommend this course to help round out knowledge and see his experienced strategy to handle simple but real-world situations.  

I would gladly purchase every course that Piotr authors and recommend the same to you.  While there are many authors out there in the PHP, Javascript spaces, Piotr's strategy is not to walk you through documentation, which many others do.  His approach is rather, here's what we're going to build, an ultra-basic hotel booking site, and even if you're experienced, you'll pick up tips along the way.

Audio quality is excellent.  Content is simple, no fluff, but follows best practices.  I learned some new things.  Recommended.
results.content_html:
Piotr holds a deep understanding of both Laravel and Vue. His code typing is fluid in both; he never pauses to consider how to call vuex state or whether some PHP function needs a forward or backslash. He's good. There's virtually no wasted time in recognizing that you, the viewer, know more about the subject than the teacher, i.e. stumbling through errors or a non-best-practice use of a controller.

The course is well worth the money and doesn't attempt to be an all-in-one masterclass. As part of my overall strategy to be the very best I can be in both Laravel & Vue, I highly recommend this course to help round out knowledge and see his experienced strategy to handle simple but real-world situations.

I would gladly purchase every course that Piotr authors and recommend the same to you. While there are many authors out there in the PHP, Javascript spaces, Piotr's strategy is not to walk you through documentation, which many others do. His approach is rather, here's what we're going to build, an ultra-basic hotel booking site, and even if you're experienced, you'll pick up tips along the way.

Audio quality is excellent. Content is simple, no fluff, but follows best practices. I learned some new things. Recommended.

results.content:
Edit 26/02/2020 : J'ai modifié ma note de 4 à 5 étoiles car Piotr vient de mettre à jour le contenu et d'autres ajouts sont à venir (Système de paiement, authentification, compte utilisateur ...), Je recommande chaudement.
---------
Cours excellent, Piotr maitrise son sujet et les chapitres s’enchaînent de manière très fluide.
Je recommande.

C'est presque un sans faute mais je trouve qu'il manque certaines parties :
• Gestion des utilisateurs/authentification
• Un début de page de paiement
• Une partie consacrée à la mise en production

Si ce cours est mis à jour, il sera alors parfait et je modifierai ma note en conséquence

results.content: Assumes a fair amount of PHP, Laravel, and general coding knowledge beforehand. Moves very quickly in places; I found myself blindly copying code without really understanding what it was doing. While Piotr's English is infinitely better than my Polish, his accent is quite thick which means you sometimes have to concentrate on that rather than the code.

response.content:
Hi, first of - thanks for feedback. Now - what is covered in the course is explained at 0:25 of the first lecture (or the preview video). In 0:50 of the same video - I clearly state what IS NOT COVERED. This includes PHP basics, OOP basics, JavaScript basics. I think one could assume if PHP or JavaScript basics are not covered, then one should not expect general programming principles would be covered. Now I understand things might be too fast for you. You can pause. You can watch again. You can even slow me down (I explain how to do it). You can see the included source code. Now, you seem to be claiming I don't explain things I code - which is completely false. Coding the course project would take max 3h instead of 18 hours, if I would not explain everything in detail along the way. You could read other reviews that confirm that. Last thing - "thick accent", that's the first time anyone mentions that, so I'd say it's a matter of preference.

To sum up my response - I'm glad you've enrolled. I really hope it would be useful for you and you'll learn a lot, like other students. Just remember to watch the first preview video, check the curriculum, and read the description. It might save you some dollars or frustration next time, because 90% of the courses clearly state what's covered inside and what's not :)

results.content:
Alright, I rarely write reviews on udemy courses but I feel compelled to do it for this one.

Before starting the course I had an okayish understanding of javascript and laravel but no knowledge about VUE.js at all and I have to say that from all the courses I have taken on the platform this is definitely between the very best ones.

Let me tell you why:

The positives:

- His knowledge about software is just incredible. He knows every little detail about vue.js, laravel, the comunication between the frontend and the backend, the environment setup... One could easily think this polish guy knows everything about web development. 
- It's very clear and understandable. Great video and sound quality.
-100% Practical. You learn step by step as you build the app. All the classes are focused on building a real life project and he makes sure to explain every step in the process and the reasoning behind them. 
-He has a github repository with all the code updated for each class. This was SUPER useful. Sometimes you might get a bug on your project while following the explanations and you can easily spot it by browsing his files or some other time you might rather listen to his explanations instead of typing any code and after the class you can just easily get the code from his repo.
-Questions. I asked a couple of well thought questions on this course and even though he took a couple of days to answer back he came with a super detailed answer of more than 1000 characters. Very clarifying. 

Room for improvement:

-It's honestly hard to point out anything negative or clunky about this course but if I had to say something, there are times where he might rush a bit too much, especially on the backend. However this might be a personal feeling, as my backend knowledge is quite short.

Overall, after this course I feel extremely confident to keep developing Vue.js - Laravel projects on my own.

this.$store.dispatch("thankYou");
results.content_html:

Before starting the course I had an okayish understanding of javascript and laravel but no knowledge about VUE.js at all and I have to say that from all the courses I have taken on the platform this is definitely between the very best ones.

Let me tell you why:

The positives:

- His knowledge about software is just incredible. He knows every little detail about vue.js, laravel, the comunication between the frontend and the backend, the environment setup... One could easily think this polish guy knows everything about web development.
- It's very clear and understandable. Great video and sound quality.
-100% Practical. You learn step by step as you build the app. All the classes are focused on building a real life project and he makes sure to explain every step in the process and the reasoning behind them.
-He has a github repository with all the code updated for each class. This was SUPER useful. Sometimes you might get a bug on your project while following the explanations and you can easily spot it by browsing his files or some other time you might rather listen to his explanations instead of typing any code and after the class you can just easily get the code from his repo.
-Questions. I asked a couple of well thought questions on this course and even though he took a couple of days to answer back he came with a super detailed answer of more than 1000 characters. Very clarifying.

Room for improvement:

-It's honestly hard to point out anything negative or clunky about this course but if I had to say something, there are times where he might rush a bit too much, especially on the backend. However this might be a personal feeling, as my backend knowledge is quite short.

Overall, after this course I feel extremely confident to keep developing Vue.js - Laravel projects on my own.

response.content: I understand when things don't work it's frustrating (so is reading such reviews :). If things would not work and you would follow instructions "step by step", there would be more people raising this, not only you. Please take into account people often miss out on something. Usually, they don't follow everything as they claim. I understand that, it's sometimes a lot to grasp. But fueling frustration on the course won't help me, as this is not really any useful feedback, and certainly won't help you - as why would it. I would suggest to be more patient in the future. Programming is something that requires patience. Table-flipping every time you get stuck or you think something does not work (when actually it's some trivial mistake) would mean you'll spend a lot of money on tables.

results.content:
The pacing is calm and informative. The instructor isn't skipping over details and I feel like I'm getting a great introduction to Laravel and Vue js. 

Only one negative comment:
Laravel 7 is now the most-current version of the framework and version 6 is one of those versions that will probably never be used. Most users will stick with v5 or skip the latest v7. 

To be fair, there has not been any v6 course content that hasn't worked with v7 yet. However, I would prefer to have the course videos updated to reflect the latest version of the framework. When learning, I prefer to learn the most-current methods.

response.content: Thanks for feedback. Unfortunately, Laravel creator decided on changing the major version every 6 months. Laravel 5.1 was released June 2015, 5.8 was out Feb 2019. Now, every major version increases every 6 months. That's why you don't see any issues with the course. Now I understand students would like the most recent version to be used, but creating the material, the project itself, creating curriculum and recording takes 3-4 months. This means almost certainly, that soon after I publish, the course is already outdated... And as you can see, that's not the case :)
response.content_html: Thanks for feedback. Unfortunately, Laravel creator decided on changing the major version every 6 months. Laravel 5.1 was released June 2015, 5.8 was out Feb 2019. Now, every major version increases every 6 months. That's why you don't see any issues with the course. Now I understand students would like the most recent version to be used, but creating the material, the project itself, creating curriculum and recording takes 3-4 months. This means almost certainly, that soon after I publish, the course is already outdated... And as you can see, that's not the case :)

results.content_html:
The pacing is calm and informative. The instructor isn't skipping over details and I feel like I'm getting a great introduction to Laravel and Vue js.

Only one negative comment:
Laravel 7 is now the most-current version of the framework and version 6 is one of those versions that will probably never be used. Most users will stick with v5 or skip the latest v7.

To be fair, there has not been any v6 course content that hasn't worked with v7 yet. However, I would prefer to have the course videos updated to reflect the latest version of the framework. When learning, I prefer to learn the most-current methods.

results.content: The course has been fantastic. I have years of experience in technology and Piotr does such a good job of explaining everything. I've been getting better and better with Laravel and Vue and I must thank Piotr for so much help. It does take much longer than I thought but worth every minute of my time.

results.content:
After finishing Laravel course by Piotr  Jura, i decided to learn Vue JS and how to use with Laravel. This course met my expectations.
Even my English is not to much good, i understanded everything easily.
Piotr is explaining things very well and clean. The most thing i liked, he is not just showing to use things also explaining logic behind it.

The project in the course not finished, but there will be updates soon. I strongly reccomend this course to people familiar with Laravel and wants to learn Vue JS.

results.content: I like the course! A lot of attention to detail, modern way to build an app. I would recommend this course to everyone who needs to get know about Laravel with Vue.js

results.content: Excellent course which is highly structured and all concepts are clearly explained with the corresponding documentation. 1 commit on GitHub per video is helpful whenever you get stuck. Highly looking forward to new sections!

results.content:
It was a very good course to understand the concepts of Vue JS and also Laravel, 
The instructor has taught some Laravel concepts as well with the Vue JS.
Apart from the programming, the instructor has explained the Grid system of bootstrap as well, which is very good for the one who doesn't know about it.

I have gaine so much knowledge while going through this course with the instructor.

results.content: Was good overall of how to use Laravel and Vue to create SPA. I did not have any background with javascript, but it was very good explained how things works. I would recommned to see this course with speed 1,25 Lastly, I would really give 5 stars if we can have a chapter with deploying this app. Thank you, Jakub
